alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:42PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Montgomery and southwestern Bath Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 842 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sharpsburg, or 7 miles north of Mount Sterling, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stoops and Reynoldsville around 850 PM EDT. Flat Creek around 855 PM EDT. Mount Sterling around 900 PM EDT. Ewington around 905 PM EDT. Owingsville around 910 PM EDT. Stepstone, Kendall Springs, Howards Mill, Coons Station and Gatewoods Station around 915 PM EDT. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 110 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
